Detailed Description

Headers of routines for the Diffie & Hellman key agreement.

Definition in file llp_dh.h.

Function Documentation

int llp_compute_dh_params ( mpint  x,
mpint  y 
)

Computes the part of the Diffie & Hellman key agreement that is sent to the connecting peer. The parameter y_out must be LLP_Y_LENGTH bytes long and x will be initialized to contain a random exponent.

Parameters:
x - random exponent used in computation.
y - address of a already allocated mpint that will store the result.
Returns:
LLP_OK if no errors occurred, LLP_OK otherwise.

Referenced by llp_handle_connection_ok(), and llp_handle_connection_request().

int llp_compute_dh_secret ( mpint  z,
mpint  y,
mpint  x 
)

Computes the shared secret generated by the Diffie & Hellman key agreement. The parameter z must be LLP_Z_LENGTH bytes long and x is expected to store an exponent randomly generated.

Parameters:
z - address of a already allocated mpint that will store the result.
y - result of modular exponentiation computed by remote peer.
x - random exponent used in computation.
Returns:
LLP_OK if no errors occurred, LLP_OK otherwise.

References liblog_error(), LLP_ERROR, LLP_OK, LLP_Z_LENGTH, and prime.

Referenced by llp_handle_connection_ok(), and llp_handle_key_exchange().
